summary: This document is a declaration by a custodian of records from Delta Air Lines, Inc., certifying the authenticity of business records provided in response to a grand jury subpoena dated January 23, 2010. It includes a detailed flight itinerary and payment record for a ticket issued on January 18, 2020, for travel between Los Angeles (LAX) and Las Vegas (LAS).

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Signed the grand jury subpoena dated January 23, 2010, requesting records from Delta Air Lines.

persons.name: Paralegal Specialist
persons.context: Signed the declaration on April 8, 2020, certifying the authenticity of Delta Air Lines records provided in response to the subpoena.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney signed a grand jury subpoena requesting specified records from Delta Air Lines, Inc.

events.title: Airline Ticket Issued
events.description: Delta Air Lines issued ticket number 0062415200393 for travel between Los Angeles (LAX) and Las Vegas (LAS).

events.title: Records Certification
events.description: A Paralegal Specialist at Delta Air Lines executed a declaration certifying the authenticity of business records provided in response to the 2010 subpoena.

keyFacts: A grand jury subpoena was issued to Delta Air Lines on January 23, 2010, by an Assistant U.S. Attorney, indicating an ongoing investigation at that time.
Delta Air Lines provided certified records in 2020 in response to the 2010 subpoena, showing continued legal proceedings related to the case.
The document includes a detailed flight itinerary for a ticket issued on January 18, 2020, for travel between LAX and Las Vegas, though the passenger name is not visible in the provided text.
The certification follows Federal Rules of Evidence 902(11) and 803(6) to establish the business records as authentic evidence.
The document demonstrates the use of financial and travel records in the investigation, specifically airline ticket data from Delta Air Lines.
